physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Tender, firm, and enlarged submandibular glands (3 to 4 cm in diameter); mild discomfort in temporomandibular joints, more on the left; no cervical, axillary, or inguinal lymphadenopathy; otherwise normal physical examination.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Submandibular glands decreased in size and tenderness after resection. Nine months later, there was slight enlargement and tenderness in the right submandibular gland.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Enlarged and mildly tender submandibular glands; oropharynx dry with diminished salivary pool; all other examinations normal.
Moderate generalized plaque-induced gingivitis; two lower molars impacted; no purulent discharge on milking the salivary glands.
